docs.title: What is Morphyn?
docs.text: Config files with built-in logic and instant hot reload.

docs.title: The Problem
docs.text:
You're balancing your game. You change enemy damage from 10 to 15. You stop Play mode. Wait for Unity to reload. Press Play. Test. Too weak. Change to 20. Stop. Wait. Play. Test again.

Repeat 50 times a day = 10+ minutes wasted.

docs.title: The Solution
docs.text:
entity Enemy {
  has damage: 10  # ← Change this to 999
}

Save. Game updates instantly. While running.

docs.title: Quick Example
docs.text:
entity Player {
  has hp: 100
  has level: 1

  on damage(amount) {
    hp - amount -> hp
    check hp <= 0: emit die
  }

  on level_up {
    level + 1 -> level
    hp + 20 -> hp
  }
}

That's it. No classes, no inheritance, no boilerplate.

docs.title: For Unity Developers
docs.text:
1. Install Download Morphyn.unitypackage

2. Create config 

entity GameSettings {
  has difficulty: "normal"
  has enemy_damage: 10
}

3. Use in C# 

double damage = System.Convert.ToDouble(
    MorphynController.Instance.GetField("GameSettings", "enemy_damage")
);

4. Edit while playing Change enemy_damage: 10 → enemy_damage: 999 and save. Value updates instantly.

docs.title: ⚡ Hot Reload Everything
docs.text:
Not just values — logic too. 

on damage(amount) {
  hp - amount -> hp
  check hp <= 0: emit die  # ← Change condition while game runs
}

docs.title: 🛡️ Built-in Validation
docs.text:
on heal(amount) {
  check amount > 0: hp + amount -> hp  # Auto-validates
  check hp > max_hp: max_hp -> hp      # Auto-clamps
}

docs.title: 🎯 Made for Game Logic
docs.text:
entity Shop {
  has gold: 100

  on buy(cost) {
    check gold >= cost: {
      gold - cost -> gold
      emit add_item("sword")
    }
  }

docs.title: Entities
docs.text:
Entities are like objects with state and behavior. 

entity Player {
  has hp: 100        # State
  on damage(amount) { # Behavior
    hp - amount -> hp
  }
}

docs.title: Events
docs.text:
Events trigger entity reactions. 

emit player.damage(25)  # Send event to player
emit heal(10)           # Send to self

docs.title: Data Flow
docs.text:
Use -> to update values. 

hp - 10 -> hp          # Subtract 10 from hp
max_hp -> hp           # Set hp to max_hp

docs.title: Checks
docs.text:
Guards that stop execution if condition fails. 

check hp > 0: emit alive       # Only if hp > 0
check gold >= cost: emit buy   # Only if enough gold

docs.title: Basic Examples
docs.text:
Note

Custom events (like damage, heal) must be triggered either from init/tick events, or externally via C# code using MorphynController.SendEventToEntity(). They don't run automatically.

docs.title: Simple Counter
docs.text:
entity Counter {
  has value: 0

  on init {
    emit log("Counter initialized")
  }

  on tick(dt) {
    value + 1 -> value
    emit log("Counter:", value)
  }
}

What happens: - init runs once when entity is created - tick runs every frame, incrementing counter

docs.title: Health System
docs.text:
entity Player {
  has hp: 100
  has max_hp: 100
  has alive: true

  on damage(amount) {
    hp - amount -> hp
    check hp <= 0: {
      0 -> hp
      false -> alive
      emit die
    }
  }

  on heal(amount) {
    check alive: {
      hp + amount -> hp
      check hp > max_hp: max_hp -> hp
    }
  }

  on die {
    emit log("Player died")
  }
}

How to use:

In standalone runtime: 

entity Game {
  on init {
    emit player.damage(50)  # Trigger damage event
    emit player.heal(20)    # Trigger heal event
  }
}

In Unity: 

MorphynController.Instance.SendEventToEntity("Player", "damage", 50);
MorphynController.Instance.SendEventToEntity("Player", "heal", 20);

docs.title: Enemy AI
docs.text:
entity Enemy {
  has hp: 50
  has damage: 10
  has state: "idle"

  on see_player {
    "chase" -> state
  }

  on tick(dt) {
    check state == "chase": emit attack
  }

  on attack {
    emit player.damage(damage)
  }

  on take_damage(amount) {
    hp - amount -> hp
    check hp <= 0: emit self.destroy
  }
}

How it works: - see_player event must be triggered externally (e.g., from Unity's OnTriggerEnter) - Once in "chase" state, tick automatically triggers attack every frame - attack sends damage event to player entity

Unity example: 

void OnTriggerEnter(Collider other)
{
    if (other.CompareTag("Player"))
    {
        MorphynController.Instance.SendEventToEntity("Enemy", "see_player");
    }
}

docs.title: Inventory System
docs.text:
entity Inventory {
  has items: pool["sword", "shield"]
  has capacity: 10

  on init {
    emit list_items  # Show initial items
  }

  on add_item(item) {
    check items.count < capacity: {
      emit items.add(item)
      emit log("Added:", item)
    }
    check items.count >= capacity: {
      emit log("Inventory full!")
    }
  }

  on remove_item(index) {
    emit items.remove_at(index)
  }

  on use_item(index) {
    items.at[index] -> current_item
    emit log("Using:", current_item)
  }

  on list_items {
    emit log("Inventory size:", items.count)
    emit items.each(show_item)
  }

  on show_item(item) {
    emit log("  -", item)
  }
}

How to use: 

// Add item
MorphynController.Instance.SendEventToEntity("Inventory", "add_item", "potion");

// Use item at index 1
MorphynController.Instance.SendEventToEntity("Inventory", "use_item", 1);

// List all items
MorphynController.Instance.SendEventToEntity("Inventory", "list_items");

docs.title: Complete Game Example
docs.text:
This example shows a complete game loop with automatic enemy spawning. 

import "player.morphyn"
import "enemy.morphyn"

entity Game {
  has score: 0
  has enemies: pool[]
  has spawn_timer: 0
  has spawn_interval: 2000

  on init {
    emit log("Game started!")
    emit spawn_enemy
  }

  on tick(dt) {
    spawn_timer + dt -> spawn_timer

    check spawn_timer >= spawn_interval: {
      emit spawn_enemy
      0 -> spawn_timer
    }

    emit enemies.each(update, dt)
  }

  on spawn_enemy {
    emit enemies.add(Enemy)
    emit log("Enemy spawned! Total:", enemies.count)
  }

  on enemy_killed {
    score + 100 -> score
    emit log("Score:", score)
  }
}

How it works:

  1. init runs once when game starts

  2. Spawns first enemy

  3. tick(dt) runs every frame

  4. Updates spawn timer
  5. Spawns new enemy every 2000ms (2 seconds)

  6. Calls update event on all enemies

  7. enemy_killed must be triggered externally when enemy dies

  8. In Unity: Call from enemy death script
  9. In standalone: Enemy can emit game.enemy_killed on death

Enemy definition (enemy.morphyn): 

entity Enemy {
  has hp: 50

  on update(dt) {
    # Enemy AI logic here
    emit log("Enemy updating")
  }

  on damage(amount) {
    hp - amount -> hp
    check hp <= 0: {
      emit game.enemy_killed  # Notify game
      emit self.destroy
    }
  }
}

Unity integration: 

public class EnemyController : MonoBehaviour
{
    void OnDestroy()
    {
        // Notify Morphyn when enemy is destroyed
        MorphynController.Instance.SendEventToEntity("Game", "enemy_killed");
    }
}

docs.title: Standalone Runtime
docs.text:
Download from Releases: - Runtime: morphyn-windows-x64.exe (Windows) / morphyn-linux-x64 (Linux/macOS) - Install script: install.ps1 / install.sh

Setup: 1. Download both files for your platform 2. Run install script to add morphyn to PATH: - Windows: .\install.ps1 - Linux/macOS: ./install.sh

Note

The install script only needs to be run once.

Usage: 

# Create a file
echo 'entity Game { has score: 0 }' > game.morphyn

# Run it
morphyn game.morphyn

git clone https://github.com/jvnkoo/morphyn.git

Build the project: 

dotnet build

The compiled binary will be in bin/Debug/net6.0/ or bin/Release/net6.0/.

docs.title: Your First Program
docs.text:
Create a file called player.morphyn: 

entity Player {
  has hp: 100
  has name: "Hero"

  on init {
    emit log("Player created!")
    emit damage(25)  # Trigger damage event from init
  }

  on damage(amount) {
    hp - amount -> hp
    emit log("HP remaining:", hp)
    check hp <= 0: emit die
  }

  on die {
    emit log("Game Over")
  }
}

docs.text:
Run your program:

Output:

HP remaining: 75

docs.title: How Events Work
docs.text:
Events in Morphyn are reactive, not automatic. They only run when:

  1. Triggered from init or tick: 

    entity Game {
  on init {
    emit player.damage(50)  # Triggers player's damage event
  }

  on tick(dt) {
    emit enemy.update(dt)   # Triggers enemy's update event
  }
}

  2. Triggered externally (from C# in Unity): 

    MorphynController.Instance.SendEventToEntity("Player", "damage", 50);

  3. Chained from other events: 

    on damage(amount) {
  hp - amount -> hp
  check hp <= 0: emit die  # damage triggers die
}

Important

Custom events like damage, heal, attack will not run unless explicitly triggered. Only init and tick run automatically.

docs.title: Hot Reload
docs.text:
The runtime automatically watches for file changes and reloads entity logic without restarting.

Example: 1. Run morphyn player.morphyn 2. Edit the file: change emit damage(25) to emit damage(75) 3. Save 4. Logic updates instantly without restarting

docs.title: Tick System
docs.text:
Entities with a tick event receive frame updates: 

entity Timer {
  has elapsed: 0

  on tick(dt) {
    # dt = milliseconds since last frame
    elapsed + dt -> elapsed
    emit log("Time:", elapsed)
  }
}

docs.title: Init Event
docs.text:
Runs once when entity is created: 

entity Player {
  has hp: 100

  on init {
    emit log("Player spawned with", hp, "HP")
  }
}

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Morphyn uses an event queue to process entity reactions. Events are processed in order, and each event can trigger additional events.

docs.title: init
docs.text:
Called when an entity is first created or spawned: 

entity Enemy {
  has hp: 50

  on init {
    emit log("Enemy spawned")
  }
}

docs.title: tick(dt)
docs.text:
Called every frame with delta time in milliseconds: 

entity Timer {
  has time: 0

  on tick(dt) {
    time + dt -> time
  }
}

docs.title: destroy
docs.text:
Marks entity for garbage collection: 

entity Enemy {
  has hp: 50

  on damage(v) {
    hp - v -> hp
    check hp <= 0: emit self.destroy
  }
}

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Sync emit is a special form of emit that executes an event immediately and synchronously, bypassing the event queue, and assigns the result to a field.

emit Entity.event(args) -> field

This enables user-defined pure functions — events that compute and return a value without side effects.

docs.title: Syntax
docs.text:
emit EventName(args) -> field
emit Entity.event(args) -> field

The result written to field is the last assigned value inside the called event.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
entity MathLib {
  on clamp(value, min, max) {
    check value < min: min -> value
    check value > max: max -> value
    value -> result
  }

  on abs(value) {
    check value < 0: value * -1 -> value
    value -> result
  }

  on lerp(a, b, t) {
    a + (b - a) * t -> result
  }
}

entity Player {
  has hp: 150
  has max_hp: 100
  has x: 0.0

  on heal(amount) {
    emit MathLib.clamp(hp + amount, 0, max_hp) -> hp
  }

  on tick(dt) {
    emit MathLib.lerp(x, 10, 0.1) -> x
  }
}

docs.title: Sync events must be pure
docs.text:
Inside a sync event, only assignments (->) and checks (check) are allowed. Using emit inside a sync event throws a runtime error.

entity MathLib {
  on clamp(value, min, max) {
    check value < min: min -> value
    check value > max: max -> value
    value -> result           # ok
  }

  on bad(value) {
    emit log("hello")         # runtime error — emit not allowed in sync event
  }
}

docs.title: Nested sync calls are forbidden
docs.text:
Calling emit X() -> field inside another sync event throws a runtime error. This prevents recursion entirely.

entity Bad {
  on recursive(value) {
    emit Bad.recursive(value) -> value  # runtime error — nested sync call
  }
}

docs.title: Return value
docs.text:
The return value is the last value assigned inside the event body, regardless of which branch executed.

on clamp(value, min, max) {
  check value < min: min -> value
  check value > max: max -> value
  value -> result             # this is the return value
}

docs.title: Comparison with regular emit
docs.text: emit X() emit X() -> field Execution Queued, deferred Immediate, synchronous Return value None Last assigned value emit allowed inside Yes No Recursion possible Yes (indirect) No Use case Events, side effects Pure computation

docs.title: Math utilities
docs.text:
entity MathLib {
  on clamp(value, min, max) {
    check value < min: min -> value
    check value > max: max -> value
    value -> result
  }

  on abs(value) {
    check value < 0: value * -1 -> value
    value -> result
  }

  on lerp(a, b, t) {
    a + (b - a) * t -> result
  }

  on normalize(value, min, max) {
    (value - min) / (max - min) -> result
  }
}

docs.title: Stat computation
docs.text:
entity StatLib {
  on apply_armor(damage, armor) {
    damage * (1 - armor / 100) -> result
  }

  on exp_to_next(level) {
    level * level * 50 -> result
  }
}

entity Player {
  has hp: 100
  has armor: 30
  has level: 5
  has exp: 0

  on take_damage(amount) {
    emit StatLib.apply_armor(amount, armor) -> amount
    hp - amount -> hp
    check hp <= 0: emit die
  }

  on add_exp(amount) {
    exp + amount -> exp
    emit StatLib.exp_to_next(level) -> needed
    check exp >= needed: emit level_up
  }
}

docs.title: Sync Emit (Immediate Call with Return Value)
docs.text:
Executes an event synchronously and assigns the result to a field. The result is the last value assigned inside the called event.

emit event_name(args) -> field
emit Entity.event_name(args) -> field

Sync events must be pure — only assignments and checks are allowed inside them. Nested sync calls are forbidden to prevent recursion.

entity MathLib {
  on clamp(value, min, max) {
    check value < min: min -> value
    check value > max: max -> value
    value -> result
  }
}

entity Player {
  has hp: 150
  has max_hp: 100

  on heal(amount) {
    emit MathLib.clamp(hp + amount, 0, max_hp) -> hp
  }
}

docs.title: Unity Bridge
docs.text: Call Unity functions from .morphyn files.

docs.title: Setup
docs.text:
using UnityEngine;
using Morphyn.Unity;

public class GameManager : MonoBehaviour
{
    void Start()
    {
        // Register callback BEFORE MorphynController.Start()
        UnityBridge.Instance.RegisterCallback("PlaySound", args => {
            string soundName = args[0]?.ToString() ?? "";
            AudioSource.PlayOneShot(Resources.Load<AudioClip>(soundName));
        });

        UnityBridge.Instance.RegisterCallback("ShowMessage", args => {
            Debug.Log($"Message: {string.Join(" ", args)}");
        });
    }
}

docs.title: Calling from Morphyn
docs.text:
entity Enemy {
  has hp: 50

  on damage(amount) {
    hp - amount -> hp
    emit unity("PlaySound", "hit")

    check hp <= 0: {
      emit unity("PlaySound", "explosion")
      emit unity("ShowMessage", "Enemy destroyed!")
    }
  }
}

docs.title: Built-in Callbacks
docs.text:
MorphynController includes these by default: 

emit unity("Log", "Hello", "World")     # Debug.Log
emit unity("Move", 1, 0, 0)             # Move controller transform
emit unity("Rotate", 45)                # Rotate controller

docs.title: Hot Reload
docs.text:
Edit .morphyn files during Play mode - changes apply instantly.

Enable: Check Enable Hot Reload on MorphynController

Example: 1. Start Play mode 2. Open player.morphyn 3. Change has damage: 10 to has damage: 999 4. Save file 5. Damage updates immediately - no restart needed

docs.title: Save/Load
docs.text:
Morphyn saves entity state as readable .morphyn files. 

// Save all entities
MorphynController.Instance.SaveState();
// Saved to: Application.persistentDataPath/MorphynData/

// Load single entity
MorphynController.Instance.LoadState("Player");

// Auto-save on quit
MorphynController.Instance.autoSave = true;

Saved file example: 

entity Player {
  has hp: 75
  has level: 5
  has gold: 230
}

docs.title: 1. One MorphynController per scene
docs.text:
// Singleton - only one instance exists
MorphynController.Instance

docs.title: 2. Register callbacks early
docs.text:
[DefaultExecutionOrder(-100)]
public class Setup : MonoBehaviour
{
    void Awake() // Use Awake, not Start
    {
        UnityBridge.Instance.RegisterCallback("MyCallback", args => {});
    }
}

docs.title: 3. Use for configs, not gameplay code
docs.text:
// GOOD - config with logic
entity ShopPrices { has swordCost: 100 }

// BAD - complex gameplay
entity ComplexAI { /* don't do this */ }

docs.title: "MorphynController not found"
docs.text:
if (MorphynController.Instance == null)
{
    Debug.LogError("Add MorphynController to scene!");
}

docs.title: "Callback not found"
docs.text:
• Register callbacks in Awake(), not Start()
  • Register BEFORE MorphynController loads scripts

docs.title: Hot reload not working
docs.text:
• Editor only (not in builds)
  • File must be in Assets folder
  • Check Enable Hot Reload is enabled

docs.title: Values not updating
docs.text:
// After changing values, read again
morphyn.SetField("Player", "hp", 50);
double hp = System.Convert.ToDouble(morphyn.GetField("Player", "hp")); // 50

docs.title: Shop with Discount Logic
docs.text:
shop.morphyn: 

entity Shop {
  has swordPrice: 100
  has potionPrice: 20
  has armorPrice: 150

  on apply_sale(percent) {
    swordPrice - 50 -> swordPrice
    potionPrice - 10 -> potionPrice
    armorPrice - 75 -> armorPrice
    emit unity("Log", "SALE! 50% OFF!")
  }
}

ShopUI.cs: 

using UnityEngine;
using UnityEngine.UI;

public class ShopUI : MonoBehaviour
{
    [SerializeField] private Text swordPriceText;

    void Start()
    {
        UpdatePrices();
    }

    void UpdatePrices()
    {
        double price = System.Convert.ToDouble(
            MorphynController.Instance.GetField("Shop", "swordPrice")
        );
        swordPriceText.text = $"Sword: ${price}";
    }

    public void OnSaleButtonClick()
    {
        MorphynController.Instance.SendEventToEntity("Shop", "apply_sale", 50);
        UpdatePrices(); // Shows 50
    }
}

docs.title: Inventory with Capacity
docs.text:
inventory.morphyn: 

entity Inventory {
  has items: pool[]
  has capacity: 10
  has gold: 100

  on add_item(name) {
    check items.count < capacity: {
      emit items.add(name)
      emit unity("Log", "Added:", name)
    }

    check items.count >= capacity: {
      emit unity("Log", "Inventory full!")
    }
  }

  on buy_item(name, cost) {
    check gold >= cost: {
      gold - cost -> gold
      emit add_item(name)
    }
  }
}

InventoryUI.cs: 

using UnityEngine;
using Morphyn.Runtime;

public class InventoryUI : MonoBehaviour
{
    public void AddSword()
    {
        MorphynController.Instance.SendEventToEntity("Inventory", "add_item", "sword");
    }

    public void BuyPotion()
    {
        MorphynController.Instance.SendEventToEntity("Inventory", "buy_item", "potion", 20);
    }

    public void ShowItems()
    {
        MorphynPool items = (MorphynPool)MorphynController.Instance.GetField("Inventory", "items");

docs.title: Enemy Spawner with Timer
docs.text:
spawner.morphyn: 

entity Spawner {
  has timer: 0
  has interval: 2000
  has maxEnemies: 10
  has currentCount: 0

  on tick(dt) {
    timer + dt -> timer

    check timer >= interval: {
      check currentCount < maxEnemies: {
        emit spawn
        0 -> timer
      }
    }
  }

  on spawn {
    currentCount + 1 -> currentCount
    emit unity("SpawnEnemy")
  }

  on enemy_died {
    currentCount - 1 -> currentCount
  }
}

Spawner.cs: 

using UnityEngine;
using Morphyn.Unity;

public class Spawner : MonoBehaviour
{
    [SerializeField] private GameObject enemyPrefab;

    void Start()
    {
        UnityBridge.Instance.RegisterCallback("SpawnEnemy", args => {
            Instantiate(enemyPrefab, transform.position, Quaternion.identity);
        });
    }

    public void OnEnemyKilled()
    {
        MorphynController.Instance.SendEventToEntity("Spawner", "enemy_died");
    }
}

docs.title: Installation Steps
docs.text:
1. Download Morphyn.unitypackage from Releases
  2. Import: Assets > Import Package > Custom Package
  3. Add to scene: GameObject > Create Empty > Add Component > Morphyn Controller
  4. Drag .morphyn files into Morphyn Scripts array
  5. Check Enable Hot Reload
  6. Press Play

Done.

docs.title: Step 1: Create Config File
docs.text:
Create player.morphyn in your Assets folder: 

entity Player {
  has hp: 100
  has damage: 25
  has level: 1

  on level_up {
    level + 1 -> level
    hp + 20 -> hp
    emit unity("Log", "Level up! New level:", level)
  }
}

docs.title: Step 2: Use in C
docs.text:
using UnityEngine;
using Morphyn.Unity;

public class PlayerController : MonoBehaviour
{
    void Start()
    {
        // Read values
        double hp = System.Convert.ToDouble(
            MorphynController.Instance.GetField("Player", "hp")
        );

        Debug.Log($"Player HP: {hp}");
    }

    void Update()
    {
        if (Input.GetKeyDown(KeyCode.L))
        {
            // Trigger event
            MorphynController.Instance.SendEventToEntity("Player", "level_up");
        }
    }
}

docs.title: Step 3: Test Hot Reload
docs.text:
1. Enter Play mode
  2. Open player.morphyn
  3. Change has hp: 100 to has hp: 999
  4. Save
  5. HP updates instantly in running game!

docs.title: What is Morphyn for Unity?
docs.text:
Config files with built-in logic and instant hot reload.

Stop restarting Unity every time you change a game balance value.

docs.title: The Problem
docs.text:
Traditional Unity workflow: 1. Change enemy HP in C# script 2. Stop Play mode 3. Wait for Unity to reload 4. Press Play 5. Test 6. Repeat 50x per day

Result: 10+ minutes wasted on context switching.

docs.title: The Solution
docs.text:
With Morphyn: 1. Change enemy HP in .morphyn file 2. Save 3. Game updates instantly while running

Note

Unity will still recompile in the background when you save .morphyn files, but your game keeps running and state is preserved.

docs.title: ❌ ScriptableObject
docs.text:
[CreateAssetMenu]
public class EnemyData : ScriptableObject
{
    public int hp = 100;
    public int damage = 25;
}

Change value → Must stop Play mode

docs.title: ✅ Morphyn
docs.text:
entity Enemy {
  has hp: 100
  has damage: 25
}

Change value → Updates while playing

docs.title: ✅ Perfect For
docs.text:
• Game balance (HP, damage, XP curves)
  • Shop systems (prices, stock)
  • Quest data (requirements, rewards)
  • AI parameters (aggro range, patrol speed)
  • Difficulty settings

docs.title: ⚠️ Not Recommended For
docs.text:
• Complex algorithms (use C#)
  • Performance-critical loops (use C#)
  • UI rendering (use Unity UI)

Rule of thumb: If you'd use a ScriptableObject, use Morphyn instead.

docs.title: Hot Reload
docs.text:
Edit logic and values in Play mode without restarting. 

on damage(amount) {
  hp - amount -> hp
  check hp <= 0: emit die  # ← Change this while game runs
}

docs.title: Built-in Validation
docs.text:
No more manual null checks or validation code. 

on heal(amount) {
  check amount > 0: hp + amount -> hp  # Auto-validates
  check hp > max_hp: max_hp -> hp      # Auto-clamps
}

docs.title: Event-Driven Logic
docs.text:
Reactive behaviors without complex state machines. 

entity Shop {
  has gold: 100

  on buy_item(cost) {
    check gold >= cost: {
      gold - cost -> gold
      emit inventory.add("sword")
    }
    check gold < cost: {
      emit unity("ShowError", "Not enough gold")
    }
  }
}
